properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A cold front is tracking over Southern and Central Quebec this evening. With the passage of the front, heavy flurries may come with severely reduced visibility and strong winds. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T08:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-04T00:57:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3703532388.2019

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY AND AIR QUALITY ADVISORY ISSUED FOR PRINCE GEORGE The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Dust Advisory and an Air Quality Advisory for Prince George due to high concentrations of particulate matter (PM 2.5). This advisory remains in effect until further notice. Exposure to PM 2.5 is particularily a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, follow the advice of your health care provider. The City of Prince George’s Clean Air Bylaw prohibits all open burning, including backyard burning, and land clearing burning. During air quality advisories, this bylaw also prohibits street sweeping activties (unless approved by an Authorized Person), recreational fires, and use of wood-burning appliances (except for sole wood burning heat users). Industry is asked to reduce emissions wherever possible during the advisory. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at www.bcairquality.ca. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:02:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-03T23:03:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2945580458.2019
Area: Prince George
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense low pressure system tracking across eastern Nova Scotia will move into the Gulf of St Lawrence later this evening. Very strong west to southwesterly winds gusting to 100 km/h have been observed just behind the passage of the low. These high gusts will diminish below warning criteria later tonight but will still gust to near 80 km/h overnight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:17:52-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY ISSUED FOR VERNON The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy, in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority, has issued a Dust Advisory for Vernon due to high concentrations of coarse particulates which are expected to persist until there is a change in current weather conditions. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Staying indoors and in air-conditioned spaces helps to reduce particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:07:12-00:00

properties.Summary:

Conditions will improve this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A storm south of Nova Scotia will reach the Gulf of St Lawrence late this evening, then the Labrador coast on Thursday. Behind this system, strong to high winds will cause blowing snow significantly reducing visibilities. In addition, these winds will accompany the snow, which could make roads icy and slippery locally. ### Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow at times heavy is expected to develop overnight tonight. Snow will continue through Thursday in the Hopedale and Nain forecast regions, but will taper to flurries over the Makkovik area around noon on Thursday. At this time, snowfall amounts of 15 to 25 cm are expected by Friday morning. Strong northeasterly winds gusting to 80 km/h will spread northwards up the coast early Thursday. These gusty winds combined with the heavy snow will result in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:02:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:03:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2525675960.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Rain, heavy at times, will continue. Further rainfall amounts of 10 to 20 mm can be expected before tapering off from west to east this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SMITHERS The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has continued a Road Dust Advisory for Smithers because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### Children, including teenagers, are at higher risk from outdoor air pollution because they often spend time being active outdoors. Young people are more likely to have asthma and their lungs are still developing. For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:07:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-03T23:08:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2518852216.2019
Area: Bulkley Valley and The Lakes - northwest including Smithers
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intense low pressure system will track across Nova Scotia this evening. Strong southeasterly winds gusting up to 100 km/h will diminish this evening as the low moves through. There is also a Les Suetes wind warning in effect from Margaree Harbour to Bay St. Lawrence. In addition, rough and pounding surf, combined with higher than normal water levels may cause some overwash and minor flooding over the Eastern Shore of mainland Nova Scotia and along south-facing coastlines of Cape Breton Island near high tide this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T06:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T20:47:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4232430643.2019
Area: Guysborough County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A clash of Pacific moisture and an Arctic cold front over the Cassiar Mountains will produce locally heavy accumulation of snow beginning tonight. General accumulations of 5 to 10 cm will fall by midday on Thursday. Along Highway 37 between Jade City and the north end of Dease Lake, travellers can expect up to 15 cm of snow by midday on Thursday. The snow will ease Thursday afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T14:45:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T22:46:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2893753030.2019
Area: Cassiar Mountains
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An intense low pressure system centred over eastern mainland Nova Scotia early this evening will track into the Gulf of St. Lawrence later tonight. Rain, heavy at times, will continue. Further rainfall amounts of 10 to 20 mm can be expected before tapering off from west to east this evening. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T06:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T22:49:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1606718879.2019
Area: Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility locally near zero in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring. A storm from the Maritimes will reach the Labrador coast on Thursday. Behind the system, strong winds will cause blowing snow significantly reducing visibilities on Thursday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:46:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:47:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3581997110.2019
Area: Schefferville, Fermont
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall, combined with melting snow, is expected. An intensifying low pressure system will move northeastward across Nova Scotia tonight and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence overnight. Rain at times heavy will taper to scattered showers or flurries by this evening. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 35 mm are expected. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T06:54:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T21:08:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4139908486.2019
Area: Moncton and Southeast New Brunswick, Fundy National Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow at times mixed with freezing rain will continue this afternoon through tonight before easing Thursday morning. Approximately 10 cm of snow has already fallen this morning around Fort Nelson with a further 5 cm this afternoon. The band of snow will shift to the southwest towards Sikanni Chief tonight, where 10 to 15 cm is forecast. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:04:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:05:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1065823521.2019
Area: Fort Nelson
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A storm approaching the Maritimes will reach the Gulf of St Lawrence late this evening, then the Labrador coast on Thursday. Behind the system, high westerly winds gusting up to 100 km/h are expected on Thursday. These high winds will also reduce visibilities in blowing snow. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:53:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:54:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0890479649.2019
Area: Minganie, Natashquan, Chevery
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A storm south of Nova Scotia will reach the Gulf of St. Lawrence late this evening, then the Labrador coast on Thursday. Behind the system, high westerly winds gusting to 100 km/h will develop late tonight and persist on Thursday. These high winds will also reduce visibilities in blowing snow. In addition, these winds will accompany the snow which could make roads icy and slippery locally. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:36:06-00:00

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snowfall with blowing snow is expected. A storm south of Nova Scotia will reach the Gulf of St Lawrence late this evening, then the Labrador coast on Thursday. It will give 25 to 40 centimetres of snow by Thursday morning over the Lower North Shore. The Chevery and Blanc Sablon regions may experience a brief period of freezing rain this evening or early tonight. Behind the storm, high westerly winds gusting to 100 km/h will develop and reduce visibilities in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:34:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:35:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3578824158.2019
Area: Natashquan, Chevery, Blanc-Sablon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Brief, intense snowfall is expected. Visibilities will be rapidly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T03:49:30-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BURNS LAKE The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Road Dust Advisory for Burns Lake because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:08:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-03T23:09:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1011835755.2019
Area: Bulkley Valley and The Lakes - southeast including Burns Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR QUESNEL The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Dust Advisory for Quesnel. High concentrations of dust are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Dust concentrations tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Exposure to dust is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have di-abetes, and lung or heart disease. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, follow the advice of your health care provider. Real-time air quality information from Quesnel and other B.C. communities can be found at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T07:03:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-03T23:04:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2325822676.2019
Area: Cariboo - north including Quesnel

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High Storm Surge levels and large waves are expected to impact the coast. Warning of potential breaking sea conditions and overwash issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec region on 2019-04-03. An intense low pressure system from the US Eastern Seaboard will give high winds over the regions mentioned below. The combination of these winds and the fact that we are currently in a period of mid-amplitude tidal range could strongly produce breaking sea conditions along the coast near theses localities, on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern daylight time). Natashquan: 2019-04-04, from 10:00 AM to 01:00 PM. Natashquan: 2019-04-04, from 10:30 PM to 01:30 AM. Chevery: 2019-04-04, from 09:30 AM to 12:30 PM. Chevery: 2019-04-04, from 09:00 PM to 12:00 AM. Blanc-Sablon: 2019-04-04, from 08:30 AM to 11:30 AM. Blanc-Sablon: 2019-04-04, from 8:30 PM to 11:30 PM. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T11:40:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-03T19:41:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0937270029.2019
Area: Natashquan, Chevery, Blanc-Sablon
properties.Author: Environment Canada
